HydrationError.what: Server-rendered HTML doesn't match client-rendered HTML
HydrationError.why: Different output between server and client render, often from browser APIs or random values
fix: Remove browser-only APIs (window, document) from initial render
Use useEffect for client-only code
Avoid Date.now() or Math.random() in render
Check for conditional rendering based on client state
Use suppressHydrationWarning only as last resort
Ensure server and client use same data sources
Check for timezone differences affecting dates

ModuleNotFound.what: Cannot find module or file to import
ModuleNotFound.why: Import path is incorrect, file doesn't exist, or package isn't installed
fix: Verify the import path is correct (check typos)
Ensure the file exists at the specified location
Install missing npm packages: npm install <package>
Check if using .js extension when needed (or remove it)
Verify tsconfig.json paths configuration
Check for case sensitivity issues (Linux vs Windows)
Restart Next.js dev server after installing packages
Clear .next cache: rm -rf .next

ServerClientMismatch.what: Different behavior between server and client components
ServerClientMismatch.why: Code behaves differently in server vs client environment
fix: Mark component with 'use client' directive if it needs browser APIs
Use 'use server' for server-only code
Move client-only logic to useEffect hooks
Check for environment-specific code (process.env, window checks)
Ensure consistent data fetching on both server and client
Use dynamic imports with ssr: false for client-only components

BuildError.why: Compilation error, missing dependencies, or configuration issue
fix: Check the specific error in build output
Verify all dependencies are installed
Clear .next folder: rm -rf .next
Check next.config.js for errors
Verify TypeScript configuration if using TS
Check for syntax errors in pages/components
Ensure all environment variables are set

APIError.why: Error in API route handler or middleware
fix: Check API route handler for errors
Verify request/response handling
Check middleware configuration
Verify HTTP method is correct (GET, POST, etc.)
Check for CORS issues
Verify API route file is in correct location (pages/api or app/api)

ImageError.why: Invalid image source, missing optimization, or configuration issue
fix: Verify image source URL is correct
Check next.config.js image domains configuration
Ensure image is accessible and valid format
Use next/image instead of tag
Check image dimensions are specified
Verify image optimization is enabled

DynamicRouteError.what: Error in dynamic route or catch-all route
DynamicRouteError.why: Invalid route parameter or missing route file
fix: Check dynamic route file naming: [param].js or [...slug].js
Verify route parameters are accessed correctly
Check for conflicting static and dynamic routes
Verify getStaticPaths returns correct paths
Check for missing getStaticProps or getServerSideProps

MiddlewareError.why: Middleware syntax error, runtime error, or configuration issue
fix: Check middleware.ts/js file for syntax errors
Verify middleware is in correct location (root or src)
Check middleware matcher configuration
Ensure middleware exports default function
Verify middleware doesn't use Node.js-only APIs
Check for infinite redirects

FontError.why: Invalid font configuration or missing font files
fix: Check next/font import and configuration
Verify font files exist in public folder
Check font family name is correct
Verify font format is supported
Check for CORS issues with external fonts
Ensure font is properly imported in _app.js or layout
Check .env.local or .env file exists
Verify environment variable names (NEXT_PUBLIC_ prefix for client)
Restart dev server after adding env variables
Check for typos in variable names
Verify variables are loaded: console.log(process.env)
Check next.config.js env configuration

TypeScriptError.why: Type errors, missing types, or TS configuration issue
fix: Check TypeScript error message for specific issue
Verify @types packages are installed
Check tsconfig.json configuration
Add type assertions if needed: as Type
Check for missing type definitions
Verify strict mode settings if too strict

SSRError.why: Error during SSR execution or data fetching
fix: Check getServerSideProps or getStaticProps for errors
Verify data fetching logic
Check for browser-only APIs in SSR code
Add error handling in data fetching
Verify API endpoints are accessible from server
Check for async/await issues in SSR functions
Check getStaticProps for errors
Verify getStaticPaths returns valid paths
Check for dynamic data in static pages
Add fallback: 'blocking' or 'true' if needed
Verify all required data is available at build time
Check for missing revalidate configuration
